newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy bourse sale to be completed by October 3.
newsitem.headline: Italy bourse sale to be completed by October 3.

text.p: Italy's bourse council said the sale of shares in a privatised Italian stock market should be completed by October 3.
The council said it aims to approve a tender for bids for a stake in the new stock market company by July 15, a statement from council chairman Francesco Cesarini said.
Earlier the Italian Treasury set a minimum 40 billion lire on the value of the stock exchange for its transformation into a private company.
It said the sale of shares would be carried out through competitive tender with 51 percent of the stock reserved for currently authorised stock market operators.
Shares in the bourse, which has registered capital of two million shares, can be purchased in minimum lots of 1,000 shares, equal to 0.05 percent of the capital.
No bidder will be able to acquire more than 100 minimum lots, equal to five percent of the capital.
The minimum price of each lot will not be less than 20 million lire.
Successful bidders will be obliged to underwrite a capital increase for the new stock market company, Borsa Italiana SpA, to 10 billion lire from two billion.
